by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer\r"},"acceptTokenOwnership()":{"details":"used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r note that token ownership can only be accepted if its total-supply is greater than zero\r"},"addConnector(address,uint32,bool)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"addReserve(address,uint32)":{"details":"defines a new reserve for the token\r can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'addConnector' instead\r \r","params":{"_ratio":"constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000\r","_token":"address of the reserve token\r"}},"change(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"claimTokens(address,uint256)":{"details":"allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users\r dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)\r \r","params":{"_amount":"the amount of tokens to claim\r","_from":"address to claim the tokens from\r"}},"completeXConversion(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,uint256)":{"details":"allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other\r token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but\r rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX.\r note that prior to version 16, you should use 'completeXConversion' instead\r \r","params":{"_conversionId":"pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction \r \r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"connectorTokenCount()":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"connectorTokens(uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"connectors(address)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"convert(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken\r note that prior to version 16, you should use 'convert' instead\r \r","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account\r","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM\r \r","_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken\r","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to\r"},"return":"conversion return amount\r"},"convertInternal(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken\r can only be called by the bancor network contract\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken\r","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r \r","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to\r"},"return":"conversion return amount\r"},"fund(uint256)":{"details":"buys the token with all reserve tokens using the same percentage\r for example, if the caller increases the supply by 10%,\r then it will cost an amount equal to 10% of each reserve token balance\r note that the function can be called only when conversions are enabled\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to increase the supply by (in the smart token)\r"}},"getConnectorBalance(address)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"getCrossConnectorReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"getCrossReserveReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"calculates the expected return of converting a given amount from one reserve to another\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getCrossConnectorReturn' instead\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount of tokens received from the user\r \r","_fromReserveToken":"contract address of the reserve token to convert from\r","_toReserveToken":"contract address of the reserve token to convert to\r"},"return":"amount of tokens that the user will receive\ramount of tokens that the user will pay as fee\r"},"getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8)":{"details":"given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee\r \r","params":{"_amount":"return amount\r","_magnitude":"1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross reserve conversion\r \r"},"return":"return amount minus conversion fee\r"},"getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256)":{"details":"calculates the expected return of buying with a given amount of tokens\r \r","params":{"_depositAmount":"amount of reserve-tokens received from the user\r \r","_reserveToken":"contract address of the reserve token\r"},"return":"amount of supply-tokens that the user will receive\ramount of supply-tokens that the user will pay as fee\r"},"getReserveBalance(address)":{"details":"returns the reserve's balance\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"reserve token contract address\r \r"},"return":"reserve balance\r"},"getReserveRatio(address)":{"details":"returns the reserve's ratio\r added in version 22\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"reserve token contract address\r \r"},"return":"reserve ratio\r"},"getReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"calculates the expected return of converting a given amount of tokens\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount of tokens received from the user\r \r","_fromToken":"contract address of the token to convert from\r","_toToken":"contract address of the token to convert to\r"},"return":"amount of tokens that the user will receive\ramount of tokens that the user will pay as fee\r"},"getSaleReturn(address,uint256)":{"details":"calculates the expected return of selling a given amount of tokens\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"contract address of the reserve token\r","_sellAmount":"amount of supply-tokens received from the user\r \r"},"return":"amount of reserve-tokens that the user will receive\ramount of reserve-tokens that the user will pay as fee\r"},"liquidate(uint256)":{"details":"sells the token for all reserve tokens using the same percentage\r for example, if the holder sells 10% of the supply,\r then they will receive 10% of each reserve token balance in return\r note that the function can be called also when conversions are disabled\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to liquidate (in the smart token)\r"}},"quickConvert(address[],uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"quickConvert2(address[],uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path\r note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand\r note that prior to version 16, you should use 'quickConvert' instead\r \r","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account\r","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM\r \r","_amount":"amount to convert from (in the initial source token)\r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"quickConvertPrioritized(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"quickConvertPrioritized2(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256[],address,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"reserveTokenCount()":{"details":"returns the number of reserve tokens defined\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'connectorTokenCount' instead\r \r","return":"number of reserve tokens\r"},"restoreRegistry()":{"details":"restores the previous contract-registry\r"},"restrictRegistryUpdate(bool)":{"details":"restricts the permission to update the contract-registry\r \r","params":{"_onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry":"indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only\r"}},"setBancorX(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract\r","params":{"_bancorX":"BancorX contract\r"}},"setConversionFee(uint32)":{"details":"updates the current conversion fee\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_conversionFee":"new conversion fee, represented in ppm\r"}},"setConversionWhitelist(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address\r when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter\r note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract\r \r","params":{"_whitelist":"address of a whitelist contract\r"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the contract ownership\r the new owner still needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new contract owner\r"}},"transferTokenOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the token ownership\r the new owner needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new token owner\r"}},"updateConnector(address,uint32,bool,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility\r"},"updateRegistry()":{"details":"updates to the new contract-registry\r"},"updateReserveVirtualBalance(address,uint256)":{"details":"updates a reserve's virtual balance\r only used during an upgrade process\r can only be called by the contract owner while the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'updateConnector' instead\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"address of the reserve token\r","_virtualBalance":"new reserve virtual balance, or 0 to disable virtual balance\r"}},"upgrade()":{"details":"upgrades the converter to the latest version\r can only be called by the owner\r note that the owner needs to call acceptOwnership on the new converter after the upgrade\r"},"withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new amount\r","_token":"ERC20 token contract address\r"}},"withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r note that reserve tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive\r unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new nodes.documentation:
@dev Bancor Converter

The Bancor converter allows for conversions between a Smart Token and other ERC20 tokens and between different ERC20 tokens and themselves. 

This mechanism opens the possibility to create different financial tools (for example, lower slippage in conversions).

The converter is upgradable (just like any SmartTokenController) and all upgrades are opt-in. 

WARNING: It is NOT RECOMMENDED to use the converter with Smart Tokens that have less than 8 decimal digits or with very small numbers because of precision loss 

Open issues:
- Front-running attacks are currently mitigated by providing the minimum return argument for each conversion
  Other potential solutions might include a commit/reveal based schemes

The Bancor converter allows for conversions between a Smart Token and other ERC20 tokens and between different ERC20 tokens and themselves. 

This mechanism opens the possibility to create different financial tools (for example, lower slippage in conversions).

The converter is upgradable (just like any SmartTokenController) and all upgrades are opt-in. 

WARNING: It is NOT RECOMMENDED to use the converter with Smart Tokens that have less than 8 decimal digits or with very small numbers because of precision loss 

Open issues:

  Other potential solutions might include a commit/reveal based schemes

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

acceptTokenOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer can only be called by the contract owner note that token ownership can only be accepted if its total-supply is greater than zero

addReserve(address,uint32).details: defines a new reserve for the token can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive note that prior to version 17, you should use 'addConnector' instead

params._ratio: constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000

claimTokens(address,uint256).details: allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)

params._amount: the amount of tokens to claim
params._from: address to claim the tokens from

completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,u.details: allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX. note that prior to version 16, you should use 'completeXConversion' instead

params._conversionId: pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract

convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256.details: converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken note that prior to version 16, you should use 'convert' instead

params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero

convertInternal(address,address,uint256,.details: converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken can only be called by the bancor network contract

params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero

fund(uint256).details: buys the token with all reserve tokens using the same percentage for example, if the caller increases the supply by 10%, then it will cost an amount equal to 10% of each reserve token balance note that the function can be called only when conversions are enabled

params._amount: amount to increase the supply by (in the smart token)

getCrossReserveReturn(address,address,ui.details: calculates the expected return of converting a given amount from one reserve to another note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getCrossConnectorReturn' instead

params._amount: amount of tokens received from the user
params._fromReserveToken: contract address of the reserve token to convert from
params._toReserveToken: contract address of the reserve token to convert to

getCrossReserveReturn(address,address,ui.return: amount of tokens that the user will receiveamount of tokens that the user will pay as fee

getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8).details: given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee

params._magnitude: 1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross reserve conversion

getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256).details: calculates the expected return of buying with a given amount of tokens

params._depositAmount: amount of reserve-tokens received from the user
params._reserveToken: contract address of the reserve token

getPurchaseReturn(address,uint256).return: amount of supply-tokens that the user will receiveamount of supply-tokens that the user will pay as fee

getReserveBalance(address).details: returns the reserve's balance note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead

getReserveRatio(address).details: returns the reserve's ratio added in version 22

getReturn(address,address,uint256).details: calculates the expected return of converting a given amount of tokens

params._amount: amount of tokens received from the user
params._fromToken: contract address of the token to convert from
params._toToken: contract address of the token to convert to

getReturn(address,address,uint256).return: amount of tokens that the user will receiveamount of tokens that the user will pay as fee

getSaleReturn(address,uint256).details: calculates the expected return of selling a given amount of tokens

params._reserveToken: contract address of the reserve token
params._sellAmount: amount of supply-tokens received from the user

getSaleReturn(address,uint256).return: amount of reserve-tokens that the user will receiveamount of reserve-tokens that the user will pay as fee

liquidate(uint256).details: sells the token for all reserve tokens using the same percentage for example, if the holder sells 10% of the supply, then they will receive 10% of each reserve token balance in return note that the function can be called also when conversions are disabled

params._amount: amount to liquidate (in the smart token)

quickConvert2(address[],uint256,uint256,.details: converts the token to any other token in the bancor network by following a predefined conversion path note that when converting from an ERC20 token (as opposed to a smart token), allowance must be set beforehand note that prior to version 16, you should use 'quickConvert' instead

params._amount: amount to convert from (in the initial source token)
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract

reserveTokenCount().details: returns the number of reserve tokens defined note that prior to version 17, you should use 'connectorTokenCount' instead

restrictRegistryUpdate(bool).details: restricts the permission to update the contract-registry

params._onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry: indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only

setBancorX(address).details: allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract

setConversionFee(uint32).details: updates the current conversion fee can only be called by the contract owner

params._conversionFee: new conversion fee, represented in ppm

setConversionWhitelist(address).details: allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

transferTokenOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the token ownership the new owner needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract

updateReserveVirtualBalance(address,uint.details: updates a reserve's virtual balance only used during an upgrade process can only be called by the contract owner while the owner is the converter upgrader contract note that prior to version 17, you should use 'updateConnector' instead

params._virtualBalance: new reserve virtual balance, or 0 to disable virtual balance

upgrade().details: upgrades the converter to the latest version can only be called by the owner note that the owner needs to call acceptOwnership on the new converter after the upgrade

withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint25.details: withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner note that reserve tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract

params._to: account to receive the new amount
